javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class Client
extends javax.swing.JApplet

This is the main class of the client.

1.0

Bjorn Husberg and Louise Tysk

Method Detail

init

public void init()
The init-method of this applet connects to the login object on the server.
Overrides:
init in class java.applet.Applet

reset

public void reset()
Does an image reset of the server and the client

pause

public void pause()
Pauses the image update thread

restart

public void restart()
Restarts the image update thread

setImage

public void setImage(byte[] JPEGArray)
Sets the image in the imagePane. The byte array is first decrypted if nedded and then decoded into a BufferedImage. The image is delta-restored if needed and finally passed to the gui for display.
Parameters:
JPEGArray - the incoming image data buffer

login

public boolean login(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password)
Performs the client-side login ritual. The incoming login request key is hashed with the password and returned to the server. If the login is successfull a RMIServer is received and an ImageUpdateThread is started.
Parameters:
username - the username
password - the password
Returns:
true if successfull, false otherwise

logout

public void logout()
Logs out the user

setArea

public void setArea(int nx,
                    int ny,
                    int nwidth,
                    int nheight)
Set the new locked area to use when requesting images
Parameters:
nx - the new x value
ny - the new y value
nwidth - the new width value
nheight - the new height value
